intro: Peucedanum porphyrodiscum, commonly known as the purple disc peucedanum, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features compound leaves with finely divided blades and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale purple. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and lesser-known member of the carrot family.
